name: Skipify
tagline: Quickly skip songs in Spotify (Mac) using a keystroke
body:
### What's Skipfiy?
Simply put, Skipify allows you to assign a hotkey to skip to the next song in Spotify. It can be used **even when Spotify is in the background** (ex: I'm browsing in Chrome and too lazy to switch to Spotify and click a button - I know this isn't just me).

### Setup
1. Double click the Skipify file you just unzipped from the download to open it up and install it as a "Service".
--screenshot here--
2. Go to **System Preferences > Keyboard > Shortcuts**.
--screenshot here--

3. Select **Services** from the left column.
--screenshot here--

4. Scroll down to the bottom of the list, under the **General** tab.

5. Click the **add shortcut** button next to the line with **Skipify**.

6. Hold down your preferred shortcut. I use **CTRL-CMD-]**, since that's what I use to go forward a page when in Chrome. _Make sure the shortcut isn't used by another application first!_

7. That's it! You can make sure it's running by going in the toolbar to **[Application] > Services** and it should say **Skipify** with the blue icon next to it.

### Authors and Contributors
@bucktower created this one night. That's about it.

### Support or Contact
Need help? I thought I laid out the instructions pretty clearly, but apparently not. File an issue on the repo.

My email is bucktower14@gmail.com for anything else.
